asons I was drawn to Audacity. I have tried Goldwave a few times. But could=
n't remember the features. The High or Low pass filters are very helpfull. =
As well as the pitch (this changes the voice either higher or lower) that h=
elps bring it out of the "muddy" static level. As far as using the "noise e=
liminator" be careful here...a little goes a long way. It will make you aud=
io sound like a bad organ piano :) The high or low filter actually does wha=
t we are wanting the noise filter to do anyway. And doesn't add its own mel=
odies. --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:

  > > Hi, give the AUDACITY software another try. Has option to slo=
w the recording down. Another nice feature is that you can use either a hig=
hpass or lowpass filter (sometimes that is all that is needed) and changing=
 the PITCH is a very handy tool. Always KEEP an original copy of your recor=
dings. I just save a copy from inside audacity (to desktop or somewhere) th=
en I will start my work on trying to clear it up. Save the original (and pr=
oceeding enhanced version(s) by using the "file" button at to left corner o=
if program. There you would SAVE "selection" as MP3.(To upload to here) or =
save to WAV (is bigger) but higher qulity. Can always convert the wav to mp=
3 from withing audacity also. *you will need to get the mps "pluging" from =
the website, and follow the information to install it "manually" (once is o=
nly needed) that way you get the mp3 converter program free. But really...A=
udacity is a pretty good program to have round. Has a nice "undo" fesature =
too, if you make a mistake. Happy Hunting ;) Jim H --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
